Container.Name: FileFlows
Container.Overview: FileFlows lets you process files in a rule flow like system. Primary focus is for video file processing, including coverting videos to standard format (hevc/ac3 etc), and other function for example, removing black bars from videos, adding chapter points for comskip/edl files and many more features It supports a Server and mutliple node setup, where you can have one server (with an internal processing node) and additional computers/machines as additional processing nodes. For NVIDIA GPU setup see https://github.com/revenz/FileFlows/wiki/Unraid-NVIDIA-Setup

Config.Name: TimeZone
Config.Description: TimeZone for the container refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones for a list of possible timezones

Config.Name: WebUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the WebUI. The container uses port 5000 this can forward any port to that in the container.

Config.Name: Data
Config.Description: Location of the database file, best to set this in appdata

Config.Name: Logs
Config.Description: logging directory, best to store this with the appdata

Config.Name: Temp Directory
Config.Description: Where temporary files will be created during the file flow process Best to put this on a cache drive or a faster ssd/nvme

Config.Name: /media/
Config.Description: Mapping to a folder in unRAID. this is optional and you can add as many as you like.

Config.Name: NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES
Config.Description: If you have multiple NVIDIA GPUs set a specific ID from the settings page
